column17: The attack took place in Belgrade, Serbia.
column18: 12/28/2008: On Sunday evening at 1900, in Belgrade, Serbia, an assailant detonated an improvised explosive device (IED), damaging a vehicle but causing no casualties. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: An improvised explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: The attack caused an unknown amount of property damage.

column17: The attack took place in Vrbas, Vojvodina, Serbia.
column18: 06/06/2009: On Saturday night at about 2200, in Vrbas, Vojvodina, Serbia, an improvised explosive device exploded underneath a vehicle belonging to the Vrbas mayor, destroying the vehicle, damaging three others nearby but causing no injuries. No group claimed responsibility.

column17: The attack occurred near Bujanovac in an unspecified city in Serbia.
column18: 07/09/2009: On Thursday night at about 0010, near Bujanovac, Serbia, assailants fired a rocket-propelled grenade at a police vehicle, wounding two police officers and damaging the vehicle. No group claimed responsibility.
column39: A police vehicle was targeted in the attack.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: A grenade was used in the attack.

column137: 08/25/2009: On Tuesday night at about 0300, in Belgrade, Serbia, assailants threw incendiaries at the Greek Embassy on Francuska Street, damaging the building but causing no casualties. The Black Sun claimed responsibility.
column158: The Greek Embassy was targeted in the attack.
column183: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column216: An unknown incendiary device was used in the attack.
column227: The attack caused property damage, although no monetary amount was established.

column17: The attack took place in Bujanovac, Pcinja, Serbia.
column18: 02/14/2010: On Sunday night, in Bujanovac, Pcinja, Serbia, unidentified militants detonated an improvised explosive device attached to a vehicle, injuring a Serbian police officer, his wife, and two passerbys. No group claimed responsibility for this incident.
column39: Unknown assailants targeted a police officer's car.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: An improvised explosive device was used in the attack.
column108: The attack damaged one police car.

column18: 05/17/2012: Assailants opened fire on a police station in Dobrosin village, Southern and Eastern Serbia region, Serbia. No one was injured, but property was damaged in the shooting. No group claimed responsibility for the attack; however, officials attributed it to the Liberation Army of Presevo, Bujanovic and Medveda (UCPMB).

column17: Incident occurred in the Bele Vode.
column18: 07/03/2012: An explosives-laden vehicle detonated in Bele Vode neighborhood in Belgrade city, Belgrade region, Serbia. One person died and another was injured in the blast. No group claimed responsibility for the attack.
column108: A vehicle was damaged in this attack.
column125: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. The target of the attack was the cousin of a witness in a drug gang trial so the incident may be criminal in nature.
